summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from June 28, 2023, summarizing major news stories. It includes a significant section on a DOJ Inspector General report criticizing the Bureau of Prisons for errors and mismanagement leading to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide in 2019. The briefing also covers numerous other stories including January 6 investigations, the Trump classified documents case, and various criminal investigations.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a DOJ Inspector General report on his 2019 suicide while in custody at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The report found failures by Bureau of Prisons staff contributed to his death.

persons.name: Michael Horowitz
persons.context: Released the DOJ internal watchdog report criticizing the Bureau of Prisons for its handling of Jeffrey Epstein before his suicide.

persons.name: Colette Peters
persons.context: Acknowledged failures in Epstein's case and agreed to implement recommended reforms following the Inspector General's report.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Mentioned in multiple news items including the classified documents case, January 6 investigations, and the Durham report.

persons.name: Walt Nauta
persons.context: Charged with conspiring with Trump to retain and conceal secret government records at Mar-a-Lago; delayed plea for a second time.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Set to testify before the House Judiciary Committee amid calls for his resignation from Republican lawmakers.

persons.name: Jim Jordan
persons.context: Leading calls for investigation into President Biden and his family, and criticizing FBI Director Wray.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Scheduled to testify before House Judiciary Committee; mentioned in context of Hunter Biden investigation and January 6 probe.

persons.name: Hunter Biden
persons.context: Subject of a DOJ investigation; mentioned in context of criticism of the plea deal and allegations of political interference.

persons.name: Gary Shapley
persons.context: Senior IRS investigator on the Hunter Biden case who testified to Congress about alleged limitations placed on prosecutor David Weiss.

persons.name: David Weiss
persons.context: The federal prosecutor leading the Hunter Biden investigation; according to IRS whistleblower Gary Shapley, he was rebuffed when seeking to bring charges in other jurisdictions.

persons.name: Jack Smith
persons.context: Investigating efforts to overturn the 2020 election and the January 6 Capitol attack; set to interview Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger.

persons.name: Brad Raffensperger
persons.context: Set to meet with special counsel Jack Smith's prosecutors as part of the investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

persons.name: Rudy Giuliani
persons.context: Interviewed by federal investigators as part of special counsel Jack Smith's investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

persons.name: John Durham
persons.context: Conducted a four-year investigation concluding the FBI should never have opened the Crossfire Hurricane investigation into Trump's campaign.

persons.name: James Comey
persons.context: Mentioned as being briefed on the Hillary Clinton campaign's plan regarding a dossier, according to the Durham report summary.

persons.name: Mark Meadows
persons.role: Former White House Chief of Staff
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of an audio recording of Trump discussing a classified Iran document with people working on Meadows's memoir.

persons.name: Mark Milley
persons.role: Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff
persons.context: Mentioned in an audio recording where Trump discussed a 'secret' Iran plan attributed to Milley and the Defense Department.

connections.description: Nauta is Trump's personal aide, charged with conspiring with him to retain and conceal classified documents.
Giuliani served as an attorney to Trump and was part of the post-election legal team under investigation by special counsel Jack Smith.
Special counsel Smith's team is interviewing Raffensperger as part of the investigation into efforts to overturn the 2020 election.
Shapley, an IRS investigator, oversaw the agency's role in the Hunter Biden probe and testified about limitations he witnessed Weiss facing.
House Judiciary Committee Chair Jim Jordan is a leading critic of FBI Director Wray and has called for investigations into his leadership.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center. A DOJ Inspector General report found BOP employees failed to search his cell and did not check on him for hours, leaving him unmonitored from 10:40 p.m. until he was found dead the next morning.

events.title: DOJ OIG Report Release on Epstein Death
events.description: The DOJ's Office of the Inspector General released a report criticizing the Bureau of Prisons for misconduct, negligence, and operational failures contributing to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide.

events.title: January 6 Capitol Attack
events.description: The attack on the U.S. Capitol by supporters of Donald Trump. Multiple stories in the briefing cover investigations, arrests, and sentencings related to the event.

events.title: FBI Director Wray Testimony
events.description: Scheduled testimony of FBI Director Christopher Wray before the House Judiciary Committee amid Republican calls for his resignation.

keyFacts: A DOJ Inspector General report found the Bureau of Prisons committed errors and mismanagement leading to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide in 2019, citing misconduct by 13 BOP employees.
The FBI concluded a separate investigation finding Epstein's death was not the result of a criminal act such as murder.
Trump aide Walt Nauta faces charges of conspiring with Trump to retain and conceal classified documents, allegedly moving boxes after a subpoena.
IRS whistleblower Gary Shapley testified that prosecutor David Weiss was rebuffed when seeking to bring charges against Hunter Biden in other jurisdictions and was denied special counsel status.
Special counsel Jack Smith is investigating efforts to overturn the 2020 election and has interviewed Rudy Giuliani and plans to interview Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger.
